title: Inflation Is Schooling Back-to-School Shopping Budgets
dc:creator: Jeremy Jones
description:
According to RetailMeNot's recent survey...40% of respondents were stressed about the money they will spend on back-to-school shopping—that’s up from 28% in 2021...“With inflation tightening budgets, consumers are shopping smarter and prioritizing different categories than we saw in 2021,” said Kristin McGrath, RetailMeNot’s shopping expert. “While electronics might be the biggest budget line item this year, it’s the smaller things that are this year’s most popular buys: School supplies, clothes and shoes make up the big three items for this year’s back-to-school shoppers.”

The post Inflation Is Schooling Back-to-School Shopping Budgets appeared first on Ziff Davis.
